title: I'm trying to write a short story about the aftermath of the fall of Rome, but I'm stuck on how to depict the power vacuum and its effects on everyday life. Any ideas?
self_text: I've been researching Roman history for years now, but I can't seem to come up with anything that feels authentic enough. I want it to be more than just "bandits in the streets" or "the church takes over." I want to show how people would have felt, what they would have done, and how their lives would have changed.  I know that there was a lot of political instability after the fall of Rome, but I don't want to focus too much on that. I want to focus on the everyday lives of ordinary people.  Any ideas?

title: Why are there two different spellings of "color"?
self_text: Color is the American spelling, while colour is the British spelling.  Why?

title: AITA for telling my mom she's a bad mother?
self_text: So I (18F) have been in therapy since I was 13 and I’m really working on establishing boundaries with my family, especially my mom (40F). She has always tried to control everything about me - what I wear, who I hang out with, what I study etc.  I just started college and I want to move out as soon as possible but my mom says that I won’t be able to afford it.   My dad is really supportive of me moving out though, he wants me to experience life outside the house. He’s also pretty good at managing money so I’ve asked him if I can talk to him about finances and he agreed.  When my mom found out that I spoke to my dad, she got mad and accused me of going behind her back and said that I’m trying to drive a wedge between them. I told her that I wasn’t doing either of those things, I simply wanted help from someone who isn’t controlling. She then went off on a rant saying how much she does for me and how ungrateful I am. After she calmed down, I told her that she doesn’t do anything *for* me, she does everything *to* me and that she’s actually not a very good mother.   She burst into tears and said that I’m hurting her feelings. She kept repeating “How could you say something like that to your mother?” I told her that I didn’t mean to hurt her feelings but that she needs to take accountability for her actions.  I feel really bad now because I don’t think I should have called her a bad mother. But I still stand by everything else I said.   AITA?

title: How do you fix a clogged shower drain?

title: How to be a good friend?
self_text: Hey guys, I'm having trouble making and keeping friends because of my social skills or lack thereof.  I am a bit socially awkward when it comes to starting conversations with people and don't know what to say in order to keep the conversation going.   Any advice on how to make new friends as an adult?

title: AITA for telling my friend she's annoying?
self_text: I (23f) have a friend, "Sarah" (24f). We've been friends since high school. She's always been the kind of person who talks about herself all the time and doesn't listen when others talk.  I used to just let it go because I didn't want to be rude or hurt her feelings. But lately it's been getting worse. Every time we hang out, she spends the whole time talking about her life and never asks me how I am. If I do try to talk about something that's going on in my life, she'll either interrupt me or change the subject back to herself.  It's really frustrating and makes me feel like our friendship is one-sided.  The other day, we were having coffee and she was going on and on about her new boyfriend. I tried to tell her about a problem I was having at work, but she cut me off and said, "Oh, that's interesting, but you won't believe what happened with my boyfriend..."  I finally snapped and told her that she's really annoying and needs to learn to listen sometimes.  She got really upset and accused me of being jealous and unsupportive.  Now she's not speaking to me and I feel bad, but I also don't think I did anything wrong.  So, AITA for telling my friend she's annoying?

title: Is there a way to make sure I don't have any hidden apps on my iPhone?

title: Why do people say "It's lit" and what does it mean?
self_text: I saw a video of someone saying that a party was “lit” and I am confused on why they said that, especially because the room was not well-lit at all. What is meant by calling something or some event “lit”?

title: AITA for making a comment about my boyfriend's mom?
self_text: So I'm dating this guy, we've been together for about 2 months. His mom is really overbearing and has made it clear she doesn't like me, but tries to hide it by being super nice and then passive aggressive after.  Yesterday I was at his house having dinner with him and his parents, and they were talking about their Christmas trip that they took last year. I hadn't heard about the story before so I asked them where they went. They said they went to Germany.  I responded "oh cool, did you go see Hitler?". My boyfriend immediately looked at me and got mad at me. He said I shouldn't say things like that because his mom lived in Germany during WWII and her family lost everything because of the war.   I apologized to his mother and told her I didn't mean anything bad by it, but he continued to be upset with me. I think it's just funny when people ask someone if they've gone to Germany and ask if they saw Hitler. I don't know why he would get so mad about it. Should I have known better than to say something like that? And am I the asshole?

title: Why are we not using the money that is currently in crypto to fund a UBI?
self_text: I mean, look at how much Bitcoin has made since its creation, and then consider that all of those profits would be able to go to helping people rather than going to the pockets of the rich who were early adopters.

title: AITA for not letting my friend have access to my phone?
self_text: I (24F) and my friend “Sarah” (25F) have been friends since high school, but we’ve grown apart in the last few years. She is a bit of an attention seeker and can be very dramatic, so it makes her hard to hang out with.  I recently got into a relationship with a man named "Jack" (27M). He's really great, he's kind and funny and knows how to make me laugh, he isn't obsessed with social media like most guys are these days, and he treats me really well.   We were hanging out with some other people on Saturday night when Sarah asked if she could use my phone because hers was dead. I told her no, because that's just something I don't do. She insisted, saying that she needed to call her boyfriend, and then tried guilt tripping me by saying I always let her borrow mine. I told her that I used to, but she would constantly go through my messages and stuff. She said she wasn't doing that anymore.   I didn't believe her, because she still does it every time I let her borrow my phone. I also think she has trust issues, because she always needs to know what everyone else is up to.   She started getting angry, yelling at me about how rude I was being. I told her that I had a right to privacy and she couldn't expect me to give her access to my personal information. She stormed off, and now she hasn't spoken to me since.  I feel bad for upsetting her, but I also feel like I did nothing wrong. Am I the asshole?

title: Why are they called gold diggers?
self_text: I was wondering why women who date men for their money/status are called gold diggers, but men that date women for their looks aren’t called “gem miners” or something like that?

title: AITA for telling my mom I think she's losing her mind?
self_text: So, my mom is 70 and has been getting really bad lately. She forgets things, like where she put her glasses or what she was doing in the kitchen.  She also gets angry easily, especially if someone questions her about something. Last week, she got mad at me because I asked her to help me carry a bag of groceries from the car into the house. She said that she didn’t know why I would ask her to do that because she couldn’t lift anything anymore.   I told her it wasn’t a big deal and that I could do it myself, but she insisted on helping anyway. We were both struggling with the bag, and she started yelling at me again. She said that I was making fun of her because I knew she couldn’t lift anything.  I tried to explain to her that I wasn’t trying to make fun of her, but she wouldn’t listen. She just kept yelling at me until I finally gave up and carried the bag myself.  The next day, she called me and apologized for yelling at me. She said that she was just having a bad day and that she didn’t mean to be so rude. I accepted her apology and we moved on. But then yesterday, she did it again. This time, she got mad at me because I reminded her that she had already taken her medicine. She said that she hadn’t taken her medicine yet and that I was trying to confuse her.  I told her that I was sure she had taken her medicine because I saw her take it earlier, but she wouldn’t believe me. She just kept yelling at me until I finally gave up and walked away. I don’t know what to do anymore. I love my mom, but I can’t keep dealing with this. It’s exhausting and frustrating. I feel like I’m walking on eggshells around her all the time.  I’ve talked to my siblings about it, and they agree that something is wrong. They want me to talk to my mom about it, but I’m afraid of upsetting her even more. I’m not sure what to do. Am I an asshole for telling my mom I think she’s losing her mind?

title: From the video game Minecraft, why is the Ender Dragon immune to beds?
self_text: I was watching a YouTuber play Minecraft and he said that beds explode when used in the End dimension because of the presence of the Ender Dragon. The YouTuber then explained that the Ender Dragon’s presence causes an error in the game’s code, which results in the bed exploding.  I don’t understand how something as simple as a dragon being present can cause such a complex thing like an error in the game’s code to happen.

title: Is it possible to get the “I’m not a robot” test to be harder than just checking boxes?
self_text: I feel like they’re making it easier for bots to pass as humans because all you have to do is check boxes that say stuff like “I am not a robot”, “I am not a robot, and I am over 18”. It feels like anyone could make a bot that can pick those out. Shouldn’t it ask more difficult questions or have some sort of visual puzzle?

title: AITA for telling my sister her boyfriend is a creep?
self_text: I (26F) have been with my boyfriend (27M) for 3 years now, and we’ve had a good relationship so far. We’ve talked about marriage in the future but haven’t really made plans or set a date. My older sister (28F) has been dating this guy (29M) for around 6 months.  She's always had bad luck with guys, she dates them, they leave her after like a month, she gets heartbroken, then repeats it over and over again. She went on a first date with him last year, and he didn’t call her back. Then six months later she got a text from him out of nowhere asking if she wanted to go on another date. Of course she did, since she hasn’t gone on a date in months. So they started seeing each other. When she told me about him, I was very concerned because he had ghosted her once already.  I tried to tell her that maybe she should reconsider him but she said she liked him. Fine, whatever. She doesn’t listen to me anyway. Anyway, things were going well between them until she told me about what happened last weekend. They went to dinner at his place, where he lives alone, and while they were eating, he took pictures of her without her knowing. He showed them to her after they finished eating and asked if she liked them. She didn’t say anything, just looked at him and said “no”. He apologized and deleted them.   He also texted her multiple times during work hours asking if she would come home early so he could see her. She told him no every time, but he kept texting her. This isn’t even getting into how much he talks about himself and how little he asks about her. I told her he was a creep and that she needs to break up with him immediately before he does something worse. She said I was being dramatic and that she likes him and wants to give him a chance. I told her fine, but don’t come crying to me when he starts doing more creepy stuff. Am I the asshole?

title: How do you ask for a refund on Shein?

I tried to ask them if they could return the game because I don't need it, but they said that they are unable to do that since it was a gift.  I am wondering if it is possible for me to get a refund on the game myself, even though I did not purchase it?

self_text: I was reading up on it and there seems to be multiple things that are going on, but I just don't understand why we can't just use more solar, wind or hydroelectricity to make up for the shortfall.  I know the answers probably aren't simple, but can someone give me some information?

title: AITA for getting mad at my mom for making me use a different toilet?
self_text: So, I've been having stomach issues lately and have been going to the bathroom more often than usual. My parents don't really get along with my stepdad, so he has his own bathroom that no one is supposed to use except him. However, my parents share a bathroom, but it gets dirty very easily because they are messy people. I was using the shared bathroom until my dad got sick of cleaning up after me, so he told me to start using my stepdad's bathroom instead. He said that since my stepdad isn't home most days, I could just use it. I didn't like this idea because I didn't want to go into my stepdad's room every time I had to use the bathroom, but I agreed anyway. After using it for a few weeks, my mom found out and started yelling at me for using it without her permission. She said that it wasn't right of me to use someone else's bathroom without asking first and that I should have used the shared bathroom even if it was dirty. I tried explaining to her that my dad told me to use it, but she wouldn't listen. She also said that I was being disrespectful to my stepdad by using his bathroom and that I should apologize to him when he comes home. I felt really upset about this because I hadn't done anything wrong and I was just trying to follow my dad's instructions. Also, I feel like it's ridiculous to be mad at me for using an empty bathroom. So am I the asshole?

title: What does “twisting the knife” mean?
self_text: I heard someone say it today and didn’t understand what they meant by it.

title: AITA for not wanting to pay the $400 bill my friend is trying to give me?
self_text: My friend, “Dave”, and I have been friends since we were kids. We both grew up in a small town with very little going on so whenever there was an event or something we wanted to do that wasn’t available locally we would drive about 2 hours away.  We’ve done this our entire lives without any issues.   I just got a new job last week after being unemployed for 8 months. The job pays alright but it isn’t great.   So Dave calls me yesterday saying he wants to go see a concert about 3-4 weeks from now and asks if I want to come along. I say sure because I love music and haven’t had anything planned for awhile anyway. So then he says the tickets are $150 each plus gas money which will be around $100 each.   I immediately said no. He kept pushing though. Saying how much fun we always have together and that he really wants me to come. Eventually I caved. I told him I can pay $150 for the ticket but no more than that. He agreed.   He texted me today asking if I could pay him $400.   I asked what for and he said the hotel room. I told him I thought we weren’t staying at a hotel. He said he never mentioned anything about us not staying at a hotel.   When I pressed him on why he didn’t mention anything about the hotel when he first asked me if I wanted to go he said he forgot. Then he said he only asked if I wanted to go to get out of doing things with his girlfriend.   I told him I don’t appreciate him using me as an excuse to get out of spending time with his girlfriend and I definitely don’t think it’s fair for him to expect me to pay $400 for a hotel room I didn’t even know about. And I definitely don’t need to spend $400 on a hotel when I just started a new job.   Then he started getting mad at me calling me cheap and inconsiderate.   I told him I’m not cheap but I am broke. I also told him I’m sorry if he feels like I’m being inconsiderate but I feel like he’s being inconsiderate by springing this on me last minute.   I still don’t understand why he’d ask me to go knowing he was planning on staying overnight. I also don’t understand why he’d make me agree to buy the tickets before telling me he was planning on getting a hotel room.    Am I the asshole for not paying the extra $250?

title: How can I tell if my boyfriend is cheating?
self_text: Hey, so I’ve been with my boyfriend for 8 months now and he has a habit of disappearing sometimes when we hang out or go on dates. It’s always only after the date, never during it but I get suspicious whenever he disappears because I don’t know where he went. We also have different friend groups which doesn’t bother me but I feel like he spends more time with his friends than mine. Sometimes when we are hanging out he gets really quiet and seems to be lost in thought then when I ask him what he was thinking about he says nothing. He tells me that he loves me and wants to marry me someday but I don’t know how to trust him anymore. Am I overreacting? Is he cheating? What should I do?

title: I was just called a nazi for disagreeing with someone about their stance on the Russo-Ukrainian War
self_text: I was talking to some guy on discord, who was trying to explain his pro-Russia position and why he thinks Russia is justified in its invasion of Ukraine. He said that NATO expansionism caused it all and that if Ukraine had stayed neutral then nothing would have happened.  I disagreed with him and tried explaining to him how Russia has been invading other countries even when they were not going towards NATO membership (Georgia in 2008, Crimea in 2014). Then he started calling me a Nazi because I disagreed with him. This is the second time I've seen people call others Nazis for having different opinions than them. Is it really becoming like that?

title: AITA for telling my wife that I'm not attracted to her anymore?
self_text: My wife and I have been married for about two years, we are both in our mid twenties and we met at college. We were madly in love with each other during our time there and it was a very passionate relationship. After graduating we moved into an apartment together, which is where things started to get weird. She had a lot of anxiety issues while in school but after graduating she got really lazy. When I say lazy I mean that she doesn't want to do anything that isn't absolutely necessary. If I ask her to help me clean the kitchen she says she doesn't feel like it. If I ask her to go grocery shopping with me she says she wants to watch TV. She is still going through some emotional problems so I try to be patient with her but sometimes I can't take it anymore. It's just that whenever I try to talk to her about something she gets defensive or shuts down and won't talk to me. This happened yesterday when I told her that I don't find her attractive anymore.  I know that sounds harsh, but it's true. The way she looks now is nothing like the girl I fell in love with. She used to be active and athletic, but now she just sits around all day watching TV and eating junk food. She has gained a lot of weight and her hygiene habits have gone downhill. I tried to tell her all of this in a gentle way, but she didn't take it well. She accused me of being superficial and said that I only cared about her appearance. She also said that I should be grateful for everything she does for me, even though she barely lifts a finger. I told her that I appreciate everything she does, but that I need to be able to be honest with her about how I feel. She then stormed off and refused to speak to me for the rest of the night.  I feel terrible about what happened, but I don't think I did anything wrong. I was just trying to be honest with her about how I feel. Am I the asshole for telling my wife that I'm not attracted to her anymore?

title: Why do some people who go to the gym, particularly guys, seem to be only working on their chest?
self_text: I've noticed that a lot of dudes at my gym just seem to want to work on their chests. They will spend like an hour doing all kinds of different chest exercises and then they leave. Is there something wrong with them or are they just trying to get big pecs?

title: AITA for not letting my sister know I’m pregnant?
self_text: Hey Reddit,  I (28F) have been with my boyfriend (30M) for five years and we live in a two bedroom house together. My sister (31F) is also living here because she can’t afford to move out and has no job. We told her she could stay as long as she gets a job but that hasn’t happened yet. She doesn’t seem to be looking either.   My boyfriend and I are going to get married next year and we found out I was pregnant last week. We were so excited when we saw the positive test and we immediately started planning for our future child. But then my sister came home from work and asked what we had been doing. I said nothing and she didn’t ask any further questions. It wasn’t until later when I overheard her talking about how much she hates being around children that I realized she might think something was up.   I don’t want to tell her yet. She would try to manipulate me into getting an abortion or giving the baby up for adoption. I don’t trust her at all. I don’t even want her knowing we got engaged yet.   AITA for keeping it a secret?

title: Why is there no such thing as a purple color in the Bible?
self_text: In Leviticus 13:32, it says that if a person has a sore on their head or forehead that turns white with fine scales, it should be shaved off and covered up for seven days. It also says that the sore should be examined by a priest after those seven days. If the sore hasn't healed yet, it should be shaved off again and covered up for another seven days. This process should continue until the sore is healed.   The Bible doesn't mention anything about purple color being used in this context, but it does say that the person should shave off all of their hair and cover up the sore with a cloth.  This seems like a strange practice to me, since I can't think of any reason why someone would want to shave off all of their hair and cover up a sore with a cloth. Is there any historical evidence to support this practice?

title: Is it illegal to make a fake Instagram account that looks like someone else’s?
self_text: So I have an ex who is very annoying and keeps trying to contact me even though I blocked him on all my socials. He has created multiple accounts just to harass me, so I was thinking about making a fake account that looks exactly like his (same profile pic, bio, everything) but I don’t intend to send any harassing messages or anything. Just want to see what he posts/does. Is this illegal?

title: AITA for getting mad at my ex for saying I was the worst girlfriend he’s ever had?
self_text: So, a couple of weeks ago, I broke up with my boyfriend of almost 2 years because he cheated on me. We were both devastated, and things were really tense between us after that, but we started to talk again and try to be friends. A few days ago, he texted me and asked if we could meet up.  I agreed, so we met up for coffee and talked about everything that happened. He apologized for cheating on me, and I told him I accepted his apology. We both said we wanted to stay friends, and then he said something that really pissed me off.  He said I was the worst girlfriend he’d ever had. I don’t know why he would say that. He knows how much it hurt me when he cheated on me, and now he’s trying to make me feel bad by saying I was a terrible girlfriend? It just doesn’t seem fair.   We got into a huge argument after that, and I left before we could resolve anything. Now he’s not talking to me, and I don’t know what to do. Should I reach out to him and apologize for getting angry, or should I just let him come to me?  Edit: Thanks for the advice everyone! I think I need to take some time to myself and figure out what I want from our friendship before I can move forward. I also think I need to stop trying to please him and start focusing on myself.  AITA?

title: AITA for calling out a coworker?
self_text: So, I work as a receptionist at a doctor’s office and there is this coworker who keeps making the same mistake over and over again - she doesn’t ask patients if they have any insurance or what kind of insurance they have so when it comes time to send bills we end up having to follow up with them because their insurance isn’t on file. She also does not confirm appointments and makes people wait for hours when the doctor is booked for something else.   I’ve tried talking to her about it multiple times but she just brushes me off and says she will do better but never does. Today, I finally had enough and called her out in front of our supervisor. Now everyone is mad at me because they say that it wasn’t my place to call her out like that and I should have gone to our supervisor privately.  Am I the asshole?

title: AITA for refusing to let my brother use my car?
self_text: So, I'm a 25M and my little brother is 18M. He just got his license a month ago but he hasn't been driving much since then because he doesn't have a car and he lives with our parents who don't want him to drive their cars.  I recently bought a car of my own. It's an old 2007 Honda Accord that cost me $3000. It runs okay, has about 160k miles on it, but the interior is really rough. It smells like weed, there are stains on the seats, and the radio barely works. My brother asked me if he could borrow it so he can go out with some friends. I said no because it was too dangerous. He tried to argue by saying "you haven't even used your car in months" which isn't true as I drove it yesterday morning, but still I said no because I didn't want him to crash my car.  He started yelling at me saying I was being selfish and that I should let him borrow it so he can get around without having to rely on mom and dad. I told him again that I wasn't letting him borrow it and he stormed off. Now my mom is mad at me for not letting him borrow my car and says I need to be more considerate of others.   AITA?

title: AITA for kicking my brother out after he stole money from my wallet?
self_text: So, I (17M) have been saving up money to buy a new phone since the beginning of school. I had about $400 saved in my wallet and kept it under my mattress. Yesterday, my brother (20M) was complaining that he didn’t have enough money to go out with his friends. I told him no because I needed to save money for my phone but he ended up taking $50 from my wallet without asking me. I found out today when I went to count how much money I had left and noticed I was missing some. When I asked him about it, he denied it at first but then admitted he took it. He said he would pay me back but I kicked him out and told him not to come home until he did. Was I an asshole?

Or if one person is an extreme neat freak and the other is a total slob.   Do you think those kinds of things could cause major issues in a marriage, or do you think people can overcome them?

title: AITA for refusing to help my sister out with money?

She loves talking about how her husband is rich and that she doesn’t have to worry about money.  She also loves telling me what I should do with my money (I live at home and pay rent) but then gets mad when I don’t follow it.   Yesterday she texted me asking if I could send her $1500 because they are having trouble paying their bills. I told her no, which led to her saying I was being selfish and not family. I tried explaining to her that I am trying to save up for a car and get out of living with my parents. But she just said “You always think about yourself!”  I still refused. Am I the asshole?

title: "I'm not even mad, that's amazing!"
self_text: I'm not even mad, that's amazing!  Is this from the movie "The Godfather"? The clip in question is a scene where Michael Corleone and his wife Kay are getting ready for their baby to be baptized. A man has been sent by another mafia family to kill Michael while he is at the church. As Michael stands at the alter saying his vows, people are being murdered by his men at other locations. This includes the man who was sent to murder him.   This sounds like it could come from the movie "Goodfellas". In Goodfellas Henry Hill makes an announcement over the intercom system of his restaurant as a way to get rid of someone who isn't paying protection money to the mob. He does so on the same day that they have some sort of ceremony or party going on. Henry announces that anyone with a red shirt should leave because the restaurant is about to be raided. It's very dark humor but also incredibly effective.  It's possible you may be referring to a clip from the film "Casino" starring Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci. In Casino Ace Rothstein hires two brothers Sam "Ace" and Nick to run the Tangiers casino for him. During the film, the brothers begin stealing money from the casino without Ace's permission. Eventually Ace confronts them and they attempt to kill him. After failing to kill him they try to steal all the money from the casino and flee the country.  However, before they can do so, Ace gets them arrested and they end up getting killed.

title: AITA for getting mad at my mom for trying to tell me what I want?
self_text: My (25F) mother has always tried to control me, and it’s something that I have been working on with her over the past few years. She is very opinionated and doesn’t like when things aren’t done a certain way.  I moved out when I was 18 and went away for college, but after graduation I ended up moving back home. This was due to financial reasons as well as not having any other options available to me, so I had no choice but to move in with my parents. I started looking for another place, but rent prices are insane where I live.   So I began dating this guy (26M) who I really liked and we were talking about moving in together, but he lived pretty far away from me and would need to get a new job if he moved here. He also wasn’t making much money because of his current job. We decided to wait until he got a better job and then decide if it made sense to move in together.   A week later my mom starts asking me if I wanted to start looking at places again because she thinks “it’s time” and that I should be living alone. She says that I am too old to still be living with my parents and I need to get out there and find myself. But I told her that I don’t want to move out right now, because I just got settled in and I didn’t want to deal with all of the stress that comes with finding an apartment. I also explained to her that I am seeing someone and we might be moving in together eventually, but that he needs to get a better job first before we can even think about doing that.   She then says that I am letting this guy make decisions for me and that I need to do what *I* want. She keeps repeating how I shouldn’t let him dictate my life. When I try to explain that we haven’t actually discussed moving in together yet, she dismisses me and continues to say that I’m being controlled by him. I told her that I am not being controlled by anyone and that I am capable of making my own decisions. I said that I thought she understood that I was seeing someone and that I was happy, but instead she tries to guilt trip me into breaking up with him.   When I ask why she is suddenly concerned about my happiness and wellbeing, she says that she is worried about me and that I will end up regretting everything if I stay with him. Then she goes on to list all of the flaws he has, most of which are things that I already know and don’t care about. I asked her why she is suddenly interested in pointing out his flaws, since she never did before. She says that she wants me to be happy and that she is only looking out for my best interests. I pointed out that she is doing the opposite of looking out for my best interests, and that she is actually trying to sabotage my relationship.   Then she gets angry and accuses me of being ungrateful and disrespectful. She tells me that she has sacrificed everything for me and that I should appreciate everything she does for me. I tell her that I do appreciate everything she does for me, but that I don’t appreciate her trying to manipulate me and control my life. She then storms off and refuses to speak to me for the rest of the day.   Now I feel bad, because I may have hurt her feelings. But I also feel like she is completely unreasonable and that she is trying to control me. AITA?

title: AITA for not letting my brother sleep at my house?
self_text: My older brother has been staying with me and my family on and off for the past couple of months, but it's always only been for a night or two here and there because he works out of town and gets home on weekends. Well, about a month ago I started working from home and he asked if he could stay longer so he can work in town instead of having to commute back and forth every weekend. I told him that I didn't mind, as long as he stayed out of my way while I was working, which was no problem.  Well, things were going okay until last week when my wife got sick and needed some help around the house. I told him that she had come down with something and might need some extra help around the house and he said he'd be happy to do whatever he could. But then he just sat there doing nothing all day. He spent most of his time playing video games and watching YouTube videos.  I tried talking to him about it, but he just said that he was tired from working so much. I told him that he wasn't working right now and that he should be helping out around the house, but he just ignored me. Finally, after a few days of this, I snapped and told him that if he wasn't going to help out around the house, he needed to leave. He got really angry and accused me of being selfish and ungrateful. Now he won't talk to me. Am I the asshole?

title: How can you tell if someone is an undercover cop?
self_text: I've been reading up on some old school police tactics and the use of informants, and it seems like there are a lot of tricks to identify them but they don't seem very reliable.  I was wondering how cops or investigators were able to confirm if someone was really a snitch back in the day before technology existed? Were there any ways to determine if someone who had "clean" records or background checks was still working with the police?  Did they ever just assume someone was working for the cops?  What about now, are there any modern techniques that can be used to verify if someone is a cop or informant?  Is it possible to find out if your phone has been tapped or if someone is recording you?  Is it possible to figure out what kind of training someone went through at the academy?

title: AITA for telling my mom to shut up at Thanksgiving?
self_text: My family is pretty weird, we have a lot of issues and it’s really hard to be around them sometimes. I don’t see them much but we do get together for holidays, and those are always so stressful. This year, we were all invited to my aunt’s house for Thanksgiving. It was supposed to be nice, everyone getting along, enjoying the food, talking about stuff that matters, etc.  But no. That didn’t happen.  My dad had been acting like a jerk since we got there. He started making fun of my weight and saying I need to lose some. Then he tried to start an argument with my uncle over politics. Then when I went into the kitchen to help my aunt out, he started complaining about how I never visit him or call him enough.  I just wanted to leave. I didn’t even want to eat dinner. But then things got worse.  My mom started yelling at my cousin’s boyfriend about his job. She said he needs to get a better job because he doesn’t make enough money. And then she started yelling at me for not having a boyfriend. “You’re almost 30, you should have a husband by now!” she yelled. I told her to shut up. She looked shocked. Everyone else did too. My dad jumped in and said I was being rude.  “It’s not rude if it’s true,” I said.   Then my mom started crying and ran off to the bathroom. My dad kept trying to tell me how rude I was being.  AITA?

title: AITA for getting mad at my brother?
self_text: So my brother (27M) has a girlfriend of about 6 months, and she's pretty okay but I don't like her very much.  I think it's because she is so similar to my mom who I have had a hard time with since I was little.  So anyway, he went on vacation with her last weekend and they were staying in a hotel.   On Sunday night when he came home from the airport he looked really sick and said he thought he might be coming down with something. He was super pale and sweating, but insisted that he didn't need to go to the doctor or anything.   He then went upstairs and laid down, and his gf came into the kitchen where I was sitting. She asked me if I could make him some soup or something for him to eat because she wasn't a good cook. I told her no.   She got all weird and tried to guilt trip me by saying "Oh come on, you wouldn't want him to get sicker would you?" And I just said no again and walked away.   Well now she's telling everyone I am an awful person for not making him soup and that I obviously hate her boyfriend. My parents are also mad at me for being rude and say that I should have made him soup even though I didn't feel like it.   AITA?

title: Why did the Titanic sink?
self_text: I'm not a history buff or anything, so please don't flame me if it is something obvious that I should know, but I was wondering why the Titanic sank. I know it hit an iceberg, but how did that cause it to sink? Surely icebergs aren't able to do that much damage?

title: AITA for saying my brother is a gold digger?
self_text: I'm (25F) in a relationship with a man (27M) and he has two brothers, one older and one younger. His oldest brother is married with children and his youngest is still at home with our parents.  We met online when we were both around 18/19 and have been together since then. He's always been very generous with me but over the years it became more obvious that he was doing things just to impress me or get something out of it. Like how he paid for an expensive gift card after I got him a cheap gift or offering to take me somewhere nice after I did something nice for him. I never asked him to do any of these things though, he always offered them up himself.  I don't think he's ever had a job because he says that if he worked there would be no time left to spend with me. And even though I hate saying it, I like that about him because sometimes I feel like I need someone who can give me their full attention. But now he's talking about getting a new car and telling me all the things we could do if he got one. We don't really have much money so I told him he needs to start looking for a job. He said he doesn't want to work but wants to save up to buy a car.  He also asks my dad for money which makes me uncomfortable because I know my dad isn't rich. When I ask him why he asks him for money he says that my dad loves helping people and he doesn't want to make him feel bad by refusing. He's done this on multiple occasions including when he wanted to go on vacation with me. He'd already booked the trip without checking whether he had enough money and then asked my dad for £300.   My brother found out about it and called him a gold digger. My boyfriend got angry and said that he wasn't a gold digger and accused my brother of being jealous of him having a girlfriend. My brother told him that if he didn't stop asking my dad for money he wouldn't let me date him anymore.  Now they're not speaking and my boyfriend is upset with me because he says I should have defended him. I told him I couldn't defend him because he was acting like a gold digger. Am I the asshole for calling my boyfriend a gold digger?

title: AITA for making a joke about my friend’s wife?
self_text: So I have this friend, let’s call him Dave. He is married to a woman named Stacy, and they are both very attractive people. They go to the gym together all the time, which is great because it means that they work on their relationship while staying healthy.  I like them both as friends, but I am still kind of jealous of how good they look.  Anyway, we were at a party last night and Stacy was talking about how she has been dieting lately. She said that she had lost some weight, but she wasn’t sure if it was enough. I joked with her that she looked like she had gained weight, but then I quickly apologized when I saw that she got upset.  She started crying and told me that she had been struggling with her body image for years. I felt really bad and tried to apologize again, but she wouldn’t listen. She ended up leaving the party early.   Dave was mad at me too, and he said that I was being insensitive. I think I might be an asshole.  AITA?

title: I am a new student and I have been struggling with my assignments for the past month, could anyone help me?
self_text: My high school did not prepare me well enough for college so now I’m failing all of my classes and I don’t know what to do anymore. It feels like every assignment is impossible because they are too complex or require skills that I don’t have yet. I’ve tried going to office hours but it doesn’t really help as they just tell me to read the textbook or ask someone else in class.  I wish I had a friend who was taking the same courses so we could work together on assignments and study for exams but everyone is always busy doing their own thing. I am starting to feel very depressed and I can’t even get out of bed sometimes.

title: AITA for asking my girlfriend to pay me back $100?
self_text: My gf (23f) and I (24m) have been together for about 6 months now. We both work, but she makes a lot more money than I do ($50k/year vs $30k/year). She's also very generous and likes to treat me.  A few weeks ago we went on a date night where we got dinner at an expensive steakhouse. The bill came out to around $200, which was way more than either of us had planned to spend. I offered to pay half, but she insisted on paying the whole thing since it was our anniversary (which it wasn't).  I thanked her for being so nice, but told her that if she wanted to split things, I would be happy to give her half. She said she didn't want anything from me, but I still gave her $100 anyway because I felt bad.  She didn't say anything when I gave her the money, but she hasn't mentioned it since. I haven't asked her about it either, but I figured she just forgot about it.  Today, she asked me if I could take her shopping tomorrow. I told her that I couldn't because I was busy with work. She seemed upset and told me that she really needed new clothes for a party next week. I apologized again and told her that maybe we could go another time.  She then brought up the $100 that I gave her a few weeks ago. She said that she thought I was trying to buy her love or something. I told her that I wasn't trying to do that, and that I just wanted to contribute to the cost of dinner. She then accused me of being cheap and selfish.  I tried to explain to her that I don't make as much money as she does, and that I can't always afford to pay for everything. But she wouldn't listen. She kept telling me that I should be grateful that she even goes out with me.   I'm starting to think that she might be right. Maybe I am cheap and selfish. But I don't know what else to do. I feel like I'm constantly walking on eggshells around her.  AITA for asking my girlfriend to pay me back $100?

It’s only in the area around my glans, not the shaft. I also haven’t had sex recently so that’s not the problem.  I don’t think it’s an STI because I got tested about two months ago after having unprotected sex with someone who turned out to have chlamydia, but everything came back negative. I still might go get retested just to be sure.

title: AITA for telling my aunt she has a problem with being entitled?
self_text: My aunt is a very sweet and nice person, but she’s also extremely entitled. She always expects me to do things for her whenever she asks, even if I have other plans or am busy. For example, last week she asked me to go shopping with her because she wanted someone to help carry the bags, despite knowing that I had plans with my friends. When I told her I couldn’t go, she got angry at me and said I was being rude.  She also expects me to pay for her when we go out to eat, which I don’t mind doing sometimes, but it’s become an expectation.   I didn’t say anything about it for a long time, but yesterday I finally snapped after she asked me to drive her to the airport at 4am on Saturday morning. I told her I couldn’t do it because I was going away with my boyfriend for the weekend. She got really mad and accused me of not caring about her.  After she left, I called her and apologized for snapping at her, but I also told her that I think she needs to stop expecting so much from me. She hung up on me and hasn’t spoken to me since.  Am I the asshole for telling her she has a problem with being entitled?

She works as an escort/adult film actress and I just don’t want her to take advantage of him.  I feel like he's being groomed by her. He always tells me how happy she makes him, and he says that she treats him well. But what if she wants something from him? She knows he’s young and naive, and she might use that against him.  I haven’t told anyone about this because I don’t want them to tell him to break up with her, or make things worse in any way. I also don’t want her to find out I said anything bad about her. It would ruin our relationship forever. I feel like I’m stuck in a nightmare. What do I do?!

title: AITA for telling my friend he needs to stop being an asshole?
self_text: So I have a friend that’s been getting on my nerves lately, and it all came to a head when we were at the bar last night. He got into a fight with a guy who was trying to talk to our other friend (who’s dating someone else), so he started yelling and swearing at him. He ended up pushing the guy around and had to be held back by everyone in the bar.  I told him that what he did was wrong, and he started saying that “he deserved it” because he was trying to get with his friend’s girlfriend. I tried explaining that even if that was true, violence isn’t the answer, but he just kept arguing with me.  He then said that he has a right to defend himself, and I asked him if he thought that shoving some random guy was defending himself. He went on about how he wasn’t going to let anyone disrespect him or his friends, and I told him that no one was disrespecting anyone. The guy was just talking to our friend.  Then he turned around and said that I need to shut up, and that I don’t know anything about friendship. I told him that I do know about friendship, and that real friends don’t act like that. Then he called me a bitch and stormed off.   Now he’s mad at me for calling him out, and I feel bad for hurting his feelings, but I also think he needs to understand that his behavior is unacceptable. Am I the asshole for telling my friend he needs to stop being an asshole?

title: AITA for refusing to give a ride to my neighbor's kid?
self_text: I (26M) live in the suburbs with my wife (25F). We have a car and we both work so it’s not always possible to be able to pick her up but sometimes we do depending on our schedules and if she asked in advance. Yesterday morning, I was getting ready for work when my neighbor came over asking me if I could give his son a ride to school because he had to take his daughter to an appointment and didn’t want her waiting outside of school for too long. I told him that I couldn’t as I had to leave in five minutes to make sure I wasn’t late for work. He got mad at me saying that I can’t just refuse to help someone out like that when they need it and that I should’ve just been late for work. I told him again that I couldn’t as I needed to get to work on time and that he should’ve thought about it before making plans that depended on other people. He stormed off after telling me that I was selfish and unhelpful. I think that he was wrong to ask me to do something last minute and then get angry at me for not being able to do it. Should I apologize or am I NTAH?
